security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' patterns are markdown inline code formatting (standard documentation syntax), not actual backtick execution. The 'Generic API/secret keys' findings refer to legitimate environment variable access for MP_API_KEY. No malicious code, data exfiltration, or security risks found.

content.value_statement: Work with crystal structures and materials data. Convert file formats, compute phase diagrams, analyze symmetry, and access the Materials Project database for computational materials science research.
actual_capabilities: Read and write crystal structure files in CIF, POSCAR, XYZ, and 100+ formats
Analyze symmetry, space groups, coordination environments, and lattice parameters
Construct phase diagrams and assess thermodynamic stability
Access Materials Project database for materials data and structures
Generate surfaces, slabs, and analyze electronic properties
Set up calculations for VASP, Gaussian, Quantum ESPRESSO, and other codes
limitations: Requires pymatgen and mp-api packages for full functionality
Materials Project API access requires a valid API key
Some analysis features require additional dependencies

best_practices: Always use environment variables (MP_API_KEY) for API credentials, never hardcode keys
Validate structures after reading to check for overlapping atoms or unrealistic bond lengths
Use SpacegroupAnalyzer to reduce structures to primitive cells before analysis
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts - use environment variables instead
Do not skip symmetry analysis when comparing structures - different space groups may look similar
Do not assume automatic format detection always works - specify format when unsure

faq.question: What file formats does pymatgen support?
faq.answer: Pymatgen supports 100+ formats including CIF, POSCAR, XYZ, PDB, JSON, YAML, and inputs/outputs for VASP, Gaussian, Quantum ESPRESSO, LAMMPS, and more.

faq.question: How do I get a Materials Project API key?
faq.answer: Create an account at https://next-gen.materialsproject.org/ and generate an API key from your dashboard. Set it as the MP_API_KEY environment variable.

faq.question: Can pymatgen analyze molecular dynamics trajectories?
faq.answer: Yes, use Xdatcar to read VASP MD trajectories and DiffusionAnalyzer to compute diffusivity and conductivity from AIMD data.

faq.question: How do I generate a supercell?
faq.answer: Use SupercellTransformation with a scaling matrix, for example: [[2,0,0],[0,2,0],[0,0,2]] for a 2x2x2 supercell.

faq.question: Does pymatgen work with other simulation codes?
faq.answer: Yes, pymatgen integrates with VASP, Gaussian, Quantum ESPRESSO, LAMMPS, CP2K, ABINIT, and can convert to/from ASE format.

faq.question: How do I analyze coordination environments?
faq.answer: Use CrystalNN from pymatgen.analysis.local_env for general cases, or VoronoiNN for Voronoi-based neighbor finding.
